program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.title: a gURLs wURLd
program.description_short: While attending an elite, dance training camp, archrival Chelsea surprises the girls by offering to declare a truce between them.
program.description_long: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, three teenage girls; Ally, from Australia, Emma from Germany and Jackie, a Singaporean local face the sad reality that they are about to split up as Ally and Emma must head back to their home countries. To their delight and amazement though, the girls accidentally discover that their mobile phones and computers can combine to physically transport them via a "chatroom" into each other's houses. It's not all fun and games though as their exploits in cyber space also prove to be dangerous. The risk of being stuck on the wrong side of the world, or never being able to return home from cyber space, constantly looms over their heads.
program.description_series: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, 3 teenage girls try to find a way to stay connected online.

program.description_long: Get ready for the rush as the adrenalin pumps through your body in this fast-paced blur of action sports and urban culture. Rush TV will profile the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.

program.description_short: It's more than a shot across the bow when young solo sailor Jennifer Travers is murdered on her yacht with a flare gun. Who would kill Jennifer in her homeport after her year-long voyage at sea? Nicola and Charlie navigate their way through the clues: a cut that won't heal, a hidden compartment and a coded message. But someone has their hand on the rudder for the twists and turns of this mystery - and they have earmarked Nicola for a watery grave.

program.title: Lake Eyre: Australia's Outback Wonder
program.description_short: A once‐in‐a‐generation event - the flooding of Lake Eyre and the dramatic transformation of the heart of Australia.
program.description_long: A once‐in‐a‐generation event - the flooding of Lake Eyre, and the dramatic transformation of the dead heart of Australia. Two filming expeditions via helicopter are launched to capture rare footage of the floodwaters from Australia's North Queensland area to the great outback rivers and then onto the usually desolate Lake Eyre. This event creates an amazing cycle of life, as the deserts blooms and birds descend from far and wide to capitalise on the short lived boom in the Australian outback.
program.description_series: A once‐in‐a‐generation event - the flooding of Lake Eyre and the dramatic transformation of the heart of Australia.

program.description_short: From winning the Cannes D'Or award for Best Feature Film, to his latest exhibition 'Mother Courage', Warwick Thornton talks about his deep connection to his country, Alice Springs and his view of social issues of Indigenous culture in modern society.
program.description_long:
Host Richard Bell, presents an incredible range of Australian indigenous artistic expression and practice, featuring works in a variety of media. Observe the local, national and international contribution artists make, the challenges they face and glimpse the future of indigenous art.
Shot on location in the many beautiful and varied places around Australia, each half hour episode will focus on one artist and how their culture inspires their modern art form.
program.description_series: Host Richard Bell presents an incredible range of Australian indigenous artistic expression and practice, featuring works in a variety of media. Shot on location around Australia, each episode will focus on one artist and how their culture inspires their modern art form.

program.title: Lurujarri Dreaming
program.description_short: 'Lurujarri Dreaming' outlines the Goolarabooloo tribe's recent history and rich cultural connection to country, using the Lurujarri Heritage Trail as its narrative. The narrator, a young Goolarabooloo tracker, guides us along the Trail, introducing people and places, and dreaming stories are told in along the way.

program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.title: The Surgery Ship
program.description_short: A team of volunteer Australian medics are sailing to the poorest nations on earth. This year they will face the most severe of medical issues, not seen in other parts of the world. Huge tumours left to grow unchecked, massive deformities and more. But the medical challenges are only half of the story. They will confront ethical decisions as they decide who will be helped and who will not. This is a searing, complex journey for the volunteer medics, as they deal with life and death cases - and balance the fates of these patients in their hands.

program.title: My Great Big Adventure
program.episode_title: My Great Big Adventure - Ep 8 - Disability
program.description_short: Approximately 1 in 5 people in Australia are living with a disability. While we know disability hinders people in certain ways, we can also celebrate the fact that it enhances them in others. Being disabled is not something to fear or shy away from - amazing potential is present in all of us, no matter what our capabilities! We help kids understand disability and what it means for people, and to discover the great achievements made by our disabled community - both as individuals and as groups.
program.description_long: This series tackles life's hard bits such as bullying, body image, family friction, identity, winning and losing, technology, friendship, disability, happiness and stress and provides the tools and knowledge for kids to deal with them. Life is one epic adventure and in any Great Big Adventure there are fun bits and hard bits. The cool bits are a breeze, but what about the tough time?
program.description_series: Life is one epic adventure and in any Great Big Adventure there are fun bits and hard bits. The cool bits are a breeze, but what about the tough time?

program.title: Food Bowl
program.episode_title: Food Bowl - Ep 2 - Papua New Guinea
program.description_short: Ananth and Leesa travel to Papua New Guinea to see how science is helping cocoa farmers grow a better future, they dive in to the world of farming sea cucumbers and see a pearl shell jewellery fashion show.
program.description_series: Food is our common ground, a universal experience that links people across cultures. Join the Food Bowl team as they discover how agriculture, science and the art of farming come together to lift lives out of poverty and ensure a safe food future.

program.title: My Family Feast
program.episode_title: My Family Feast s1 - Ep 8 - The Indians
program.description_short: When a Bengali bride and a Punjabi groom come together for their wedding, Sean Connolly learns how to prepare an Indian feast for an unforgettable celebration.
program.description_long: Think back for a moment to the first time you were invited to dinner at your best friend or prospective partner's home - sharing a meal with someone else's family is still one of the most intimate and insightful experiences that we have available to us in the modern age. During My Family Feast, we'll meet members of the entire family - grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles and second cousins - to gain a complete insight into their particular immigrant experience, be they first generation, second generation, or eighth generation Australians. As we learn a new recipe we will discover the stories and traditions that this particular recipe evokes.
program.description_series: My Family Feast is a celebration of food, family and stories of life. Food is the central theme that brings families and communities together and this new series defines a family as a group of people who come together to eat, to talk, to have fun and to support each other: a group of people who are very often in a strange land trying to retain their traditional culture and to live and understand a new culture.

One is the storyteller who sets the scene, one is the dedicated listener (and chief interrupter) and the other three create the characters and act out the stories with imagination and humour.
program.description_series: The gentle tale of five best friends - Faraway the Aardvark, Louisa the Polar Bear, Florrie the Dog, Sam the Monkey and Georgie the Penguin - who live on a beautiful patchwork quilt and take us on wonderful journeys and adventures.

program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.title: Dance Academy: 1st Year
program.description_short: The first years are given trust exercises to help forge connections with their pas de deux partners. Tara is frustrated when Christian refuses to participate, however they connect unexpectedly when Tara follows him to the beach and Christian rescues her from a dangerous situation. Meanwhile Kat feels betrayed by Tara's secret crush on Ethan and Sammy finds himself tied to Abigail for 24 hours.
program.description_long: A high energy teen drama that follows six teenagers attending the National Academy of Dance. They're young, beautiful and have one year to prove their worth. CAST: Xenia Goodwin, Tim Pocock, Alicia Banit, Tom Green

program.title: Food Safari
program.description_short: Food Safari delves into the delicious world of Croatian food and Maeve enlists her friend Dennis Valcich, chef, author and passionate promoter of the food from his homeland to run through the key ingredients used in the cuisine.
program.description_long: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home. Each episode is a detailed journey into a single cuisine, with tips on how to source ingredients locally, as well as prepare and cook them with authentic results.

program.episode_title: Living Black: In Conversations - Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest
program.description_short: This week Karla Grant talks to one of the most powerful men in Australia - Andrew Forrest, alias 'Twiggy'- who just this year pledged half his wealth to charity. Forrest reveals how he rose from a Jackaroo in West Australia, to a mining magnate and the world's 9th richest man.

program.description_series: Living Black is Australia's premier Indigenous current affairs program. Hosted by Karla Grant, the half-hour show provides timely, intelligent and comprehensive coverage of the issues affecting the Indigenous community. It reports many stories largely ignored by the mainstream media.

program.title: a gURLs wURLd
program.description_short: Alarm bells ring when Nicholas insists on delivering a birthday present to Jackie at her [non existant] home in Hamburg.
program.description_long: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, three teenage girls; Ally, from Australia, Emma from Germany and Jackie, a Singaporean local face the sad reality that they are about to split up as Ally and Emma must head back to their home countries. To their delight and amazement though, the girls accidentally discover that their mobile phones and computers can combine to physically transport them via a "chatroom" into each other's houses. It's not all fun and games though as their exploits in cyber space also prove to be dangerous. The risk of being stuck on the wrong side of the world, or never being able to return home from cyber space, constantly looms over their heads.
program.description_series: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, 3 teenage girls try to find a way to stay connected online.

program.title: Rush TV
program.description_short: Sydney surfer Perth Standlick grew up on one of the world's most famous beaches. So when he traded the iconic surfing spot of Bondi for breaks in Bulgaria's Black Sea, it was an eye-opening journey. Rush TV follows his 3000 km trip in the film Surfing The Wild East.
program.description_long: Get ready for the rush as the adrenalin pumps through your body in this fast-paced blur of action sports and urban culture. Rush TV will profile the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.
program.description_series: Rush TV profiles the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.

program.title: Return To Lake Eyre: The Deluge
program.description_short: In 2009, flooding rains ended the worst drought in history for eastern Australia. Paul Lockyer returned to Lake Eyre 12 months later to investigate the flooding that followed.
program.description_long: The bigger the drought, the bigger the flood. That certainly held true over the past year for the eastern half of Australia, with flooding rains ending the worst drought in history. The signs that the weather was turning began in 2009, when a deluge in the tropical north set the great desert rivers flowing through Central Australia. For the first time in years, the water flowed all the way to Lake Eyre, the huge salt pan in the dead heart of the continent. ABC TV reporter Paul Lockyer covered the drought in 2009, and now returns to Lake Eyre 12 months later to investigate the floods sweeping across much of south-west Queensland.
program.description_series: In 2009, flooding rains ended the worst drought in history for eastern Australia. Paul Lockyer returned to Lake Eyre 12 months later to investigate the flooding that followed.

Host Richard Bell, presents an incredible range of Australian indigenous artistic expression and practice, featuring works in a variety of media. Observe the local, national and international contribution artists make, the challenges they face and glimpse the future of indigenous art.
Shot on location in the many beautiful and varied places around Australia, each half hour episode will focus on one artist and how their culture inspires their modern art form.

program.title: Creative Minds
program.description_short: Stephen Page, indigenous dancer, choreographer and theatrical story-teller, steps thoughtfully through his own rich life, from childhood influences and family tragedy, to his mature creative work as Artistic Director of Bangarra, Australia's premier indigenous Dance Theatre company.
program.description_long:
Stephen Page, indigenous dancer, choreographer and theatrical story-teller, steps thoughtfully through his own rich life, from childhood influences and family tragedy, to his mature creative work as Artistic Director of Bangarra, Australia's premier indigenous Dance Theatre company.
'Creative Minds' brings the audience into intimate contact with the people who create Australian art or who contribute in a significant way to Australian cultural life. Each program explores in depth an artist's life story and the influences that inform his or her work, using the artist's own words, memories, and insights. In this series we meet Geoffrey Rush, Stephen Page, Kate Grenville and Robyn Archer.

program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.description_short: Ronan O'Connor takes his drug rehabilitation clients on an 800km walk along Spain's Camino de Santiago, for them to face their demons, and in the process his own life falls apart.
program.description_long: Ronan O'Connor works in a rehabilitation centre with people who have drug addiction, who are often very socially disadvantaged and have deep psychological issues. He takes a small group of clients on the 800km Camino de Santiago, to face their demons. In the process his own life falls apart.

program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.title: My Great Big Adventure
program.episode_title: My Great Big Adventure - Ep 9 - Identity
program.description_short: In a world where fitting in is paramount, it's hard for kids to find themselves and express their individuality in a safe space. We tackle cultural identity, sexual identity, adoption, cliques, and belonging to help kids ask questions to discover who they really are, and who they really want to be.
program.description_long: This series tackles life's hard bits such as bullying, body image, family friction, identity, winning and losing, technology, friendship, disability, happiness and stress and provides the tools and knowledge for kids to deal with them. Life is one epic adventure and in any Great Big Adventure there are fun bits and hard bits. The cool bits are a breeze, but what about the tough time?
program.description_series: Life is one epic adventure and in any Great Big Adventure there are fun bits and hard bits. The cool bits are a breeze, but what about the tough time?

program.title: Food Bowl
program.description_short: The Food Bowl team is in Timor Leste this week seeing how Australian scientists are helping to build a safe food future for one of the poorest countries in the world where 41 percent of children are underweight for this age.
program.description_series: Food is our common ground, a universal experience that links people across cultures. Join the Food Bowl team as they discover how agriculture, science and the art of farming come together to lift lives out of poverty and ensure a safe food future.

program.title: My Family Feast
program.episode_title: My Family Feast s1 - Ep 9 - The Argentineans
program.description_short: Sean Connolly experiences the many flavours of Argentina when he meets the Yoia family and learns cooking techniques for a lively Sunday afternoon asado, a barbeque, Argentinean style.
program.description_long: Think back for a moment to the first time you were invited to dinner at your best friend or prospective partner's home - sharing a meal with someone else's family is still one of the most intimate and insightful experiences that we have available to us in the modern age. During My Family Feast, we'll meet members of the entire family - grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles and second cousins - to gain a complete insight into their particular immigrant experience, be they first generation, second generation, or eighth generation Australians. As we learn a new recipe we will discover the stories and traditions that this particular recipe evokes.
program.description_series: My Family Feast is a celebration of food, family and stories of life. Food is the central theme that brings families and communities together and this new series defines a family as a group of people who come together to eat, to talk, to have fun and to support each other: a group of people who are very often in a strange land trying to retain their traditional culture and to live and understand a new culture.

program.description_short: Food Safari sizzles with colour, flavour and texture as it savours the wonderful complexity of Singaporean food. Maeve meets up with two Singaporean friends to guide her through the range of ingredients.
program.description_long: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home. Each episode is a detailed journey into a single cuisine, with tips on how to source ingredients locally, as well as prepare and cook them with authentic results.

program.title: My Australia
program.description_long: My Australia shows how young visitors from the Asia-Pacific region can get more involved in living a real Australian experience, and enjoy their time in the country as well as meet new people.These experiences will include adventure tourism such as swimming and surfing, social and community events such as volunteering and hosting a barbeque, and personal challenges such as busking, learning to cook, or playing the didgeridoo. Our young guests come from China, India, Indonesia and all over Asia, and they are keen to get involved in new Australian challenges. Tune in to My Australia to find out how they go, and what they find out along the way.
program.description_series: My Australia shows young people from our region experiencing the real Australia.

program.title: Living Black: In Conversations
program.episode_title: Living Black: In Conversations - Kyah Simon
program.description_short: She was the first Indigenous woman to score a goal for the Australian Women's Football Team (the Matildas). Born in Sydney, into a family of sporting greats, Kyah moved from Rugby League to the round ball game and it's paid off. Now Living Black gets the story behind the young football legend Kyah Simon.
program.description_long: She was the first Indigenous woman to score a goal for the Australian Women's Football Team (the Matildas). Born in Sydney, into a family of sporting greats, Kyah moved from Rugby League to the round ball game and it's paid off. Now Living Black gets the story behind the young football legend Kyah Simon.
program.description_series: Living Black is Australia's premier Indigenous current affairs program. Hosted by Karla Grant, the half-hour show provides timely, intelligent and comprehensive coverage of the issues affecting the Indigenous community. It reports many stories largely ignored by the mainstream media.

program.description_series: At Catalyst we know that science is a dynamic force for change. Each week Catalyst brings you stories from Australia and around the world. Our passion to meet scientists at the forefront of discovery is matched by our fascination with science breakthroughs however big or small. Science changes all our lives. For better or worse, we are committed to showing you what our future holds.

program.description_short: The gentle tale of five best friends - Faraway the Aardvark, Louisa the Polar Bear, Florrie the Dog, Sam the Monkey and Georgie the Penguin - who live on a beautiful patchwork quilt and take us on wonderful journeys and adventures.
program.description_long: Discover the wonderful world of five furry friends who live on a magical patchwork quilt - an endless landscape of unexpected locations waiting to be explored. More than anything, these five friends love to tell each other stories. One is the storyteller who sets the scene, one is the dedicated listener (and chief interrupter) and the other three create the characters and act out the stories with imagination and humour.

Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.

program.title: a gURLs wURLd
program.description_short: When Dan is bitten by a snake, Jackie and Emma have no option but to use the chatroom to take him to Singapore for treatment.
program.description_long: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, three teenage girls; Ally, from Australia, Emma from Germany and Jackie, a Singaporean local face the sad reality that they are about to split up as Ally and Emma must head back to their home countries. To their delight and amazement though, the girls accidentally discover that their mobile phones and computers can combine to physically transport them via a "chatroom" into each other's houses. It's not all fun and games though as their exploits in cyber space also prove to be dangerous. The risk of being stuck on the wrong side of the world, or never being able to return home from cyber space, constantly looms over their heads.
program.description_series: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, 3 teenage girls try to find a way to stay connected online.

program.title: Rush TV
program.description_short: Filmmaking and action sports go hand in hand, and for Queenslander Al Hardy it's wheels, big and small, that capture his eye. Al is self-taught, and has worked his way up from the bottom to create a blossoming career that entails filming the gnarliest action from the best riders the dirt world has to offer.
program.description_long: Get ready for the rush as the adrenalin pumps through your body in this fast-paced blur of action sports and urban culture. Rush TV will profile the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.

program.description_long: Follow Australia's up and coming young male cricketers as they compete to be crowned the first ever Cricket Superstar, and earn a rookie contract for the 2012-13 season. How will they cope with the rigours of daily training and match day situations? And how will they handle the curve balls spun their way? Find out on Cricket Superstar.

program.episode_title: Mr & Mrs Murder s1 - Ep 10 - Little Boxes
program.description_short: When upper crust James Langlan is found harpooned through the chest in a heritage bathing box, it sends a dark ripple through a wealthy seaside community. Was it a robbery gone wrong? A crime of passion? Or was money the murder motive? As Nicola and Charlie wade into the double lives of the esteemed elite, they find themselves deep in sordid secrets and lies. Through a humble household spice, a romantic ringtone and a piece of driftwood, our heroes uncover a killer who doesn't quite fit the mould.

program.description_short: Kamilaroi/Gamilaraay/Gummaroi man Reko Rennie was born in Melbourne in 1974. Having received no formal training in the Arts, Reko's teenage affair with graffiti and street art has shaped Reko's contemporary work.
program.description_long:
Host Richard Bell, presents an incredible range of Australian indigenous artistic expression and practice, featuring works in a variety of media. Observe the local, national and international contribution artists make, the challenges they face and glimpse the future of indigenous art.
Shot on location in the many beautiful and varied places around Australia, each half hour episode will focus on one artist and how their culture inspires their modern art form.

program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.title: My Great Big Adventure
program.episode_title: My Great Big Adventure - Ep 10 - Happiness
program.description_short: Research shows that Australian children have become increasingly unhappy over time. More and more kids are now experiencing higher levels of depression, anxiety and stress due to more pressure and more worries in their lives - so in these circumstances, along with the humdrum of everyday life, where can they find their joy? We show kids how to grow, create and develop strategies to identify what happiness means to them, and how to apply it to their lives by creating an existence of happiness for themselves and others!
program.description_long: This series tackles life's hard bits such as bullying, body image, family friction, identity, winning and losing, technology, friendship, disability, happiness and stress and provides the tools and knowledge for kids to deal with them. Life is one epic adventure and in any Great Big Adventure there are fun bits and hard bits. The cool bits are a breeze, but what about the tough time?
program.description_series: Life is one epic adventure and in any Great Big Adventure there are fun bits and hard bits. The cool bits are a breeze, but what about the tough time?

program.title: Food Investigators
program.description_short: Dr Renee Lim investigates one of the biggest dangers to our national health: salt. She finds out where it's hiding in our food.
program.description_long: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.
program.description_series: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.

program.title: My Family Feast
program.episode_title: My Family Feast s1 - Ep 10 - The Greeks
program.description_short: On St. George's Day Sean Connolly joins George Gavalas and his family to honour the day of his saintly namesake and he discovers how to make a flavoursome Greek family feast.
program.description_long: Think back for a moment to the first time you were invited to dinner at your best friend or prospective partner's home - sharing a meal with someone else's family is still one of the most intimate and insightful experiences that we have available to us in the modern age. During My Family Feast, we'll meet members of the entire family - grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles and second cousins - to gain a complete insight into their particular immigrant experience, be they first generation, second generation, or eighth generation Australians. As we learn a new recipe we will discover the stories and traditions that this particular recipe evokes.
program.description_series: My Family Feast is a celebration of food, family and stories of life. Food is the central theme that brings families and communities together and this new series defines a family as a group of people who come together to eat, to talk, to have fun and to support each other: a group of people who are very often in a strange land trying to retain their traditional culture and to live and understand a new culture.

program.description_short: The gentle tale of five best friends - Faraway the Aardvark, Louisa the Polar Bear, Florrie the Dog, Sam the Monkey and Georgie the Penguin - who live on a beautiful patchwork quilt and take us on wonderful journeys and adventures.
program.description_long: Discover the wonderful world of five furry friends who live on a magical patchwork quilt - an endless landscape of unexpected locations waiting to be explored. More than anything, these five friends love to tell each other stories. program.title: Study English
program.description_short: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!
program.description_long: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease! Study English is designed for students at an advanced level of English who are preparing to go onto University or College, where English will be the language of tuition. In Australia, the IELTS test assesses potential students fluency in English prior to being accepted into University or College. Study English can be used as a resource in preparation for this test (in conjunction with other resources), or as a stand-alone aid to advanced English language learning. The series covers the four basic language skills: reading, listening, writing and speaking. Presented by Margot Politis, each episode covers a different topic and explores different aspects of the English language. Our content draws on authentic material that you can watch, and listen to, plus online study notes, tips and activities for practice and consolidation. Entertaining and informative, Study English is essential viewing for anyone wishing to improve their English language ability for work, school or pleasure.
program.description_series: Test your English reading, writing, listening and speaking skills with the help of this new series from the producers of Nexus and pass your IELTS test with ease!

program.title: Food Safari
program.description_short: Food Safari revels in centuries old dishes cooked by passionate chefs & home cooks as it explores Hungarian cuisine. Maeve meets up with chef Stephen Oroszvari who has a one man mission to excite the world about the flavours of his homeland.
program.description_long: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home. Each episode is a detailed journey into a single cuisine, with tips on how to source ingredients locally, as well as prepare and cook them with authentic results.
program.description_series: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home.

program.title: My Australia
program.description_long: My Australia shows how young visitors from the Asia-Pacific region can get more involved in living a real Australian experience, and enjoy their time in the country as well as meet new people.These experiences will include adventure tourism such as swimming and surfing, social and community events such as volunteering and hosting a barbeque, and personal challenges such as busking, learning to cook, or playing the didgeridoo. Our young guests come from China, India, Indonesia and all over Asia, and they are keen to get involved in new Australian challenges. Tune in to My Australia to find out how they go, and what they find out along the way.
program.description_series: My Australia shows young people from our region experiencing the real Australia.

program.title: Dance Academy: 1st Year
program.episode_title: Dance Academy: 1st Year - Ep7- Crush test dummies
program.description_short: Christian reluctantly agrees to dance in Ethan's showcase but can't stand the derivative choreography. In order to show this ballet boy some real hip-hop, Christian takes Ethan home to Maroubra. Sammy admits to having feelings for someone at the Academy and while Tara and Kat try to figure out her identity, Tara gives Kat a lesson on what it means to have a crush.

program.title: Living Black: In Conversations
program.episode_title: Living Black: In Conversations - Stephen & David Page
program.description_short: Bangarra Dance Theatre redefined how the world thinks about Indigenous dance. The brothers behind it, director Stephen Page and music composer David Page have dedicated their lives to depicting the world's oldest living culture in new ways.
program.description_series: Living Black is Australia's premier Indigenous current affairs program. Hosted by Karla Grant, the half-hour show provides timely, intelligent and comprehensive coverage of the issues affecting the Indigenous community. It reports many stories largely ignored by the mainstream media.

program.title: a gURLs wURLd
program.description_short: Ally and Jackie's good deed backfires on them and they're forced to go on the run from the police.
program.description_long: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, three teenage girls; Ally, from Australia, Emma from Germany and Jackie, a Singaporean local face the sad reality that they are about to split up as Ally and Emma must head back to their home countries. To their delight and amazement though, the girls accidentally discover that their mobile phones and computers can combine to physically transport them via a "chatroom" into each other's houses. It's not all fun and games though as their exploits in cyber space also prove to be dangerous. The risk of being stuck on the wrong side of the world, or never being able to return home from cyber space, constantly looms over their heads.
program.description_series: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, 3 teenage girls try to find a way to stay connected online.

program.title: Rush TV
program.description_short: Build a course and they will come. That was the case for the Red Bull City Scramble, an enduro cross event in downtown Auckland, New Zealand. Hometown hero Chris Birch designed the course - which offers all sorts of obstacles for the riders to tackle - including boulders, logs and water crossings.
program.description_long: Get ready for the rush as the adrenalin pumps through your body in this fast-paced blur of action sports and urban culture. Rush TV will profile the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.
program.description_series: Rush TV profiles the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.

program.description_short: On Who Do You Think You are? Comedian Adam Hills retraces the desperate journeys undertaken by his migrant ancestors, from Central Europe and Malta. With their families torn apart by war and prejudice, both his Great Grandfathers risked everything for a new life in Australia. He also discovers a medieval ancestor who made his fortune from a barbaric business.
program.description_long: Well-known Australians Adam Hills, Asher Keddie, Susie Porter, John Howard, Don Hany, Michael Caton, Rove McManus and Lex Marinos play detective as they go in search of their family history, revealing secrets from the past.

program.title: Mr & Mrs Murder s1
program.episode_title: Mr & Mrs Murder s1 - Ep 11 - Keeping Up Appearances
program.description_short: In the middle of the night, a beautiful young woman falls to her death from the window of a prominent plastic surgery clinic. It looks like a straightforward suicide, but Nicola and Charlie soon discover that looks can be deceiving. Through birdcalls, stylish sculptures and a ring ruse, our dynamic duo will put everything on the line to crack the case, even if it means a close encounter with the surgeon's needle.
program.description_series: Charlie and Nicola are crime scene cleaners who get carried away with helping solve the mysteries the police have trouble closing.

program.title: Cloudstreet
program.description_short: WWII brings bad luck to both the Lamb and Pickles families. Then Sam Pickles inherits a house in Perth and when a further run of bad luck leads him to rent one half of it out, the Lambs become tenants in No.1 Cloud Street.
program.description_long: During the years of WWII, bad luck robs Sam Pickles of the fingers on his right hand and the Lambs' youngest son is left brain damaged through a near-drowning. But Sam Pickles inherits a huge house in Perth, Western Australia, and when a further run of bad luck leads him to rent one half of it out, the Lambs become tenants in No.1 Cloud Street.
program.description_series: Cloudstreet tells the story of 2 families in 1940s Australia who suffer separate catastrophes and flee to Perth to pick up the pieces of their lives.

program.title: Cliffy
program.description_short:
In the small Victorian regional town of Colac, 61-year-old Cliff Young is an oddity. He's a vegetarian and he's a teetotaller, and a potato farmer. Cliff spends his free time running. When the potato crop fails again, Cliff enters the inaugural 550 mile Sydney-to-Melbourne Ultra Marathon.
Waiting for Cliff in Sydney are the world's greatest distance runners and a media that views his ramshackle entourage with wide-eyed incredulity. Five days later, thousands flock to the finish line to witness Cliffy winning by the proverbial country mile.
program.description_long:
In the small Victorian regional town of Colac, 61-year-old Cliff Young (Kevin Harrington) is an oddity. For a start, he's a vegetarian. And he's a teetotaller. Add to that, he's a virgin and still lives on the family farm with his mother.
Cliff scrounges out a meagre existence farming potatoes and a few dairy cattle. That's not so odd in these parts. But when he's not battling the fickleness of nature, Cliff doesn't head to the pub or the footy ground like most. He spends his time running, covering vast distances in a single day. On one of these runs, he meets a local girl, Mary, and an unexpected connection is formed.
When the potato crop fails - again - Cliff enters the inaugural 550 mile Sydney-to-Melbourne footrace. He hooks up with his old friend, Wally, who hasn't trained a decent runner in years, and who now lives a sad existence alone.
This unlikely duo set out to defy the doubters and qualify for the gruelling race. But waiting for Cliff in Sydney are the world's greatest distance runners and a media that views his ramshackle entourage with wide-eyed incredulity.
Foregoing sleep, Cliff runs eighteen hours a day. When he hits the wall and can't go on, Mary is on hand to help him through. When he takes the lead and shuffles on, Australia is utterly transfixed. Five days later, a nation celebrates when Cliffy wins by the proverbial country mile.
Post race, Cliff marries his sweetheart Mary to the cheers of thousands of well-wishers. But fame is a fickle mistress and Cliff soon finds himself far removed from his comfort zone as entrepreneurs circle and stark city skyscrapers replace lush green paddocks.
The death of his mother sees Cliff return home to the family farm, a changed man.
program.description_series:
In the small Victorian regional town of Colac, 61-year-old Cliff Young is an oddity. He's a vegetarian and he's a teetotaller, and a potato farmer. Cliff spends his free time running. When the potato crop fails again, Cliff enters the inaugural 550 mile Sydney-to-Melbourne Ultra Marathon.
Waiting for Cliff in Sydney are the world's greatest distance runners and a media that views his ramshackle entourage with wide-eyed incredulity. Five days later, thousands flock to the finish line to witness Cliffy winning by the proverbial country mile.

program.title: Bondi Vet Series 3
program.description_short: A beautiful kelpie is brought to Chris in a terrible state. Plus, at the Australian Reptile Park, a first time alligator Mum has been dropping her eggs out in the open and not in the nest. The eggs will be hard boiled if left out in the sun so Chris and the keepers need to rescue them.
program.description_series: Featuring charismatic and energetic Sydney Veterinarians, Dr. Chris Brown and Dr. Lisa Chimes in the breathtaking backdrop of one of Australia's most famous landmarks, Bondi Beach. Chronicling the adventures of Dr. Chris, Bondi Vet allows viewers a unique insight into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets and the animals he devotes his days to caring for and treating.

program.title: Food Investigators
program.description_short: Dr Renee Lim and Joe Avati put the kebab in rehab. They'll be finding out why one of Australia's favourite snacks might not be as bad for you as you think.
program.description_long: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.
program.description_series: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.

program.title: My Family Feast
program.episode_title: My Family Feast s1 - Ep 11 - The Afghans
program.description_short: Rahman and his wife Arian teach Sean Connolly how to prepare exotic Afghani food for the annual Eid al‐Adha festival.
program.description_long: Think back for a moment to the first time you were invited to dinner at your best friend or prospective partner's home - sharing a meal with someone else's family is still one of the most intimate and insightful experiences that we have available to us in the modern age. During My Family Feast, we'll meet members of the entire family - grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles and second cousins - to gain a complete insight into their particular immigrant experience, be they first generation, second generation, or eighth generation Australians. As we learn a new recipe we will discover the stories and traditions that this particular recipe evokes.
program.description_series: My Family Feast is a celebration of food, family and stories of life. Food is the central theme that brings families and communities together and this new series defines a family as a group of people who come together to eat, to talk, to have fun and to support each other: a group of people who are very often in a strange land trying to retain their traditional culture and to live and understand a new culture.

program.episode_title: Food Safari s2 - Ep 10 - Sri Lankan
program.description_short: Food Safari explores the colourful fresh flavours & seductive charm of Sri Lankan cooking. Maeve visits a fragrant spice emporium with top Australian Sri Lankan chef Peter Kuruvita from Flying Fish restaurant who hones in on the essentials.
program.description_long: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home. Each episode is a detailed journey into a single cuisine, with tips on how to source ingredients locally, as well as prepare and cook them with authentic results.

program.title: My Australia
program.description_long: My Australia shows how young visitors from the Asia-Pacific region can get more involved in living a real Australian experience, and enjoy their time in the country as well as meet new people.These experiences will include adventure tourism such as swimming and surfing, social and community events such as volunteering and hosting a barbeque, and personal challenges such as busking, learning to cook, or playing the didgeridoo. Our young guests come from China, India, Indonesia and all over Asia, and they are keen to get involved in new Australian challenges. Tune in to My Australia to find out how they go, and what they find out along the way.
program.description_series: My Australia shows young people from our region experiencing the real Australia.

program.title: Dance Academy: 1st Year
program.description_short: Mocking her friends' obsession with teen popstar, Myles Kelly, Kat creates a video of herself dancing to one of his songs and then posts it on the internet. She is surprised when the record company invites her to dance in Myles's next video clip... and stunned when sparks fly between herself and the heart-throb.
program.description_long: A high energy teen drama that follows six teenagers attending the National Academy of Dance. They're young, beautiful and have one year to prove their worth. CAST: Xenia Goodwin, Tim Pocock, Alicia Banit, Tom Green

program.title: a gURLs wURLd
program.description_short: When the chatroom won't allow Jackie to return to Singapore, the girls have to resort to some inventive improvisation to ensure no one discovers she's stuck in Australia.
program.description_long: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, three teenage girls; Ally, from Australia, Emma from Germany and Jackie, a Singaporean local face the sad reality that they are about to split up as Ally and Emma must head back to their home countries. To their delight and amazement though, the girls accidentally discover that their mobile phones and computers can combine to physically transport them via a "chatroom" into each other's houses. It's not all fun and games though as their exploits in cyber space also prove to be dangerous. The risk of being stuck on the wrong side of the world, or never being able to return home from cyber space, constantly looms over their heads.
program.description_series: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, 3 teenage girls try to find a way to stay connected online.

program.title: Rush TV
program.description_short: The mantra for BMX whiz kid Kyle Baldock is "Go big, or go home". The 21-year-old hails from Queensland's Gold Coast, yet this pro rider is now spreading his talents internationally, and is on his way to cracking the big time in the US. While he was home, Rush TV took the chance to catch up with him.
program.description_long: Get ready for the rush as the adrenalin pumps through your body in this fast-paced blur of action sports and urban culture. Rush TV will profile the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.

program.title: Who Do You Think You Are? Series 5
program.episode_title: Who Do You Think You Are? Series 5 - Ep 2 - Asher Keddie
program.AltTitle: Who Do You Think You Are? s5
program.description_short: On Who Do You Think You Are? Actress Asher Keddie sets out to find the origins of her creative passions, discovering that she comes from a very long line of artistic performers. Including an acting ancestor whose story shares eerie parallels to her own life, and a nineteenth century musician who played a part in some of the most significant moments of his time.
program.description_long: Well-known Australians Adam Hills, Asher Keddie, Susie Porter, John Howard, Don Hany, Michael Caton, Rove McManus and Lex Marinos play detective as they go in search of their family history, revealing secrets from the past.

program.title: Cricket Superstar s1
program.description_short: An injury withdrawal is inevitable in this intense competition, but who will it be? Plus, the boys face a surprise Double Dismissal.
program.description_long: Follow Australia's up and coming young male cricketers as they compete to be crowned the first ever Cricket Superstar, and earn a rookie contract for the 2012-13 season. But first, these young sportsmen must impress the judges including cricketing legend Allan Border. Will the boys deal with the pressure? How will they cope with the rigours of daily training and match day situations? And how will they handle the curve balls spun their way? Find out on Cricket Superstar.

program.episode_title: Mr & Mrs Murder s1 - Ep 12 - Zootopia
program.description_short: When a cheetah keeper dies and a hippo keeper goes missing, it looks like the food chain has been reversed at Maabade Zoo. But it isn't the animals out for blood. It's a murder. But as Nicola and Charlie close in on the killer, they suddenly find themselves potential victims.
program.description_series: Charlie and Nicola are crime scene cleaners who get carried away with helping solve the mysteries the police have trouble closing.

program.description_short: The Lambs open a corner store in the front room of their half of the house and make their own life, whereas the Pickles are blown by the winds of fate. Sam gets a job in the Mint, while Dolly spends more time in the bar. But the house - the living, groaning house - is an uncomfortable presence.

program.title: Howzat!
program.description_short: Howzat! is the story of how in 1976 businessman Kerry Packer caused a cricket war by secretly signing up fifty of the world's best cricketers and establishing World Series Cricket, a highly-successful rebel group which challenged the Establishment and thrust the game into a new era of professionalism.

program.description_short: A king cobra at the Australian Reptile Park needs urgent attention to remove scales stuck to his right eye. But getting hold of one of the world's most venomous snakes is a frightening experience!
program.description_series: Featuring charismatic and energetic Sydney Veterinarians, Dr. Chris Brown and Dr. Lisa Chimes in the breathtaking backdrop of one of Australia's most famous landmarks, Bondi Beach. Chronicling the adventures of Dr. Chris, Bondi Vet allows viewers a unique insight into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets and the animals he devotes his days to caring for and treating.

program.description_long:
Host Richard Bell, presents an incredible range of Australian indigenous artistic expression and practice, featuring works in a variety of media. Observe the local, national and international contribution artists make, the challenges they face and glimpse the future of indigenous art.
Shot on location in the many beautiful and varied places around Australia, each half hour episode will focus on one artist and how their culture inspires their modern art form.

program.title: First Footprints
program.episode_title: First Footprints - Ep 1 - Super Nomads: 50,000 To 30,000 Years Ago
program.description_short:
Super Nomads: Arrival and Dispersal 50,000 - 30,000 BP
70,000 years ago modern people are confined to Africa. But one tenacious bunch races across Asia and makes the first open-ocean crossing in human history . They encounter Sahul or Greater Australia - a virgin continent full of weird and deadly megafauna, deserts and glaciers. Trade networks soon criss-cross the continent and innovations in art and technology spread rapidly. They engrave the first image of a human face, they make the first maps. Against the odds the first Australians occupy every available niche for our species and thrive. This is the time when creation stories and song lines of Aboriginal cosmology come into being. First Australians today call this The Dreaming. It's the longest period of social and religious continuity anywhere in the world.
program.description_series: FIRST FOOTPRINTS is the untold story of how Aboriginal people came to Australia over 50,000 years ago and adapted and thrived in this harsh continent. As the first people out of Africa, they made the first open-ocean crossing in history, conducted the world's earliest ritual cremation, invented technologies such as the hafted stone axe and boomerang, etched the earliest depiction of the human face, engraved the world's first maps, made the earliest narrative paintings - all pre-dating the Cro-Magnon of Lascaux.

program.title: Food Investigators
program.description_short: On Food Investigators tonight, Dr Renee Lim researches ice-cream - why does it now have so many ingredients, what are they and why are they necessary. She'll also be looking at how much Australia is eating - is four serves a week too much for our nation's health?
program.description_long: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.

program.title: My Family Feast
program.episode_title: My Family Feast s1 - Ep 12 - The Serbians
program.description_short: It's Stana Kolundzija's 66th birthday and she invites Sean Connolly to join her friends and extended family for a scrumptious Serbian feast.
program.description_long: Think back for a moment to the first time you were invited to dinner at your best friend or prospective partner's home - sharing a meal with someone else's family is still one of the most intimate and insightful experiences that we have available to us in the modern age. During My Family Feast, we'll meet members of the entire family - grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles and second cousins - to gain a complete insight into their particular immigrant experience, be they first generation, second generation, or eighth generation Australians. As we learn a new recipe we will discover the stories and traditions that this particular recipe evokes.
program.description_series: My Family Feast is a celebration of food, family and stories of life. Food is the central theme that brings families and communities together and this new series defines a family as a group of people who come together to eat, to talk, to have fun and to support each other: a group of people who are very often in a strange land trying to retain their traditional culture and to live and understand a new culture.

program.description_short: The gentle tale of five best friends - Faraway the Aardvark, Louisa the Polar Bear, Florrie the Dog, Sam the Monkey and Georgie the Penguin - who live on a beautiful patchwork quilt and take us on wonderful journeys and adventures.
program.description_long: Discover the wonderful world of five furry friends who live on a magical patchwork quilt - an endless landscape of unexpected locations waiting to be explored. More than anything, these five friends love to tell each other stories. One is the storyteller who sets the scene, one is the dedicated listener (and chief interrupter) and the other three create the characters and act out the stories with imagination and humour.

program.title: Food Safari
program.description_short: Food Safari revels in the clever combination of Portuguese & African cuisines that are the key to much of Brazilian cooking. Maeve teams up with two talented Brazilian cooks, both of whom are passionate about their homeland & keen to show off the ingredients used.
program.description_long: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home. Each episode is a detailed journey into a single cuisine, with tips on how to source ingredients locally, as well as prepare and cook them with authentic results.
program.description_series: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home.

program.title: a gURLs wURLd
program.description_short: Emma's excuse to avoid going on a family holiday puts the girls' place in the semi finals in serious jeopardy.
program.description_long: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, three teenage girls; Ally, from Australia, Emma from Germany and Jackie, a Singaporean local face the sad reality that they are about to split up as Ally and Emma must head back to their home countries. To their delight and amazement though, the girls accidentally discover that their mobile phones and computers can combine to physically transport them via a "chatroom" into each other's houses. It's not all fun and games though as their exploits in cyber space also prove to be dangerous. The risk of being stuck on the wrong side of the world, or never being able to return home from cyber space, constantly looms over their heads.
program.description_series: After spending a year studying together in Singapore, 3 teenage girls try to find a way to stay connected online.

program.title: Rush TV

Rush TV caught up with Dave at his home where he shares his views on surfing, saving the environment, and how quality time in his veggie patch, inspires his passions to take flight.
program.description_long: Get ready for the rush as the adrenalin pumps through your body in this fast-paced blur of action sports and urban culture. Rush TV will profile the most prolific people in the world of action sports including snowboarding, bmx, skating, surfing and motocross.

program.title: Next Stop Hollywood
program.description_short: The excitement, frustrations, fears and tears as six actors - Alyicia, HaiHa, Penny, Craig, Luke and Michael - set off from Australia to compete for roles during the frenzied US TV pilot season in Hollywood. Hollywood is tough and 98% of actors who go there won't fulfil their dreams.
program.description_long:
Six ambitious young Aussie actors embark on one of the toughest journeys of their lives with a clear challenge in mind --- to score a TV role in Hollywood.
This original documentary series follows the actors as they compete for roles during the frenzied and chaotic US TV pilot season. The series captures all their excitement, frustrations, struggles, fears and tears as they compete with the world's best and try to navigate the travails of the entertainment industry in LA.
Alycia Debnam-Carey, 18 (Sydney); HaiHa Le, 29 (Melbourne); Penelope Mitchell, 22 (Melbourne); Michael Clarke-Tokely, 22 (Melbourne); Craig Anderson, 35 (Sydney); and Luke Pegler, 30 (Sydney) allow our cameras to follow their every move as they pursue their dreams of fame and fortune in Hollywood's dream factory.
Candid and upfront, the series explores what it takes to be an actor in the most competitive city in the world. Facing judgement and rejection on a daily basis, these six young actors open their lives and hearts to the cameras in an unflinching group portrait.
Some of the show's cast come to LA fully connected to the industry with representation from agents or managers in place. Others are on the fringe and need to get connected quickly if they are to have a shot at reaching their goals.
Some are facing their past demons and others are simply staking their claim in a town where it is so easy to be passed over. Sometimes funny, sometimes heartbreaking, NEXT STOP HOLLYWOOD takes a broad swipe at the myth of the overnight success story.
program.description_series: Six ambitious young Aussie actors embark on one of the toughest journeys of their lives with a clear challenge in mind --- to score a TV role in Hollywood.

program.title: First Footprints
program.episode_title: First Footprints - Ep 2 - The Great Drought; 30,000 To 15,000 Years Ago
program.description_short: The Great Drought: Last Glacial Maximum 30,000 - 15,000 BP. For thousands of years people live with Australia's strange and ferocious megafauna like the 6 metre giant lizard Megalania and the marsupial lion. These beasts all become extinct as massive climate change hits Australia brought on by the Last Ice Age. Sea levels drop 130m and deserts spread from 60% to 90% of the continent in the biggest drought ever experienced by humans. As conditions worsen, rather than moving, people adapt to the new environments. In many parts they become desert people with new technologies like the grindstone. Over 10,000 years of punishing drought people developed a culture and a Law that enabled them to survive in places we can't live in today.
program.description_series: FIRST FOOTPRINTS is the untold story of how Aboriginal people came to Australia over 50,000 years ago and adapted and thrived in this harsh continent. As the first people out of Africa, they made the first open-ocean crossing in history, conducted the world's earliest ritual cremation, invented technologies such as the hafted stone axe and boomerang, etched the earliest depiction of the human face, engraved the world's first maps, made the earliest narrative paintings - all pre-dating the Cro-Magnon of Lascaux.

program.title: Food Investigators
program.description_short: The Heptinstall family spend a week eating like great grandma's family in the 1940s. What can we learn in these tough times about how mum, dad and the kids coming together for real family meals makes a real difference? We also investigate whether chicken soup has curative properties, and reveal how every time you step into a major super-market you are being taken on a carefully planned psychological ride designed to mess with your mind and stimulate your senses.
program.description_long: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.
program.description_series: Can what you eat help you get a good night's sleep? Does eating like our ancestors improve our health? And the staples in your cupboard - eggs, bread, milk. The choice is now bewildering, so how do you choose? Our experts will be able to help you through the maze. Food Investigators looks at the food on our plates, revealing the facts behind the food we eat that will surprise you, shock you, and definitely affect your appetite.

program.title: My Family Feast
program.episode_title: My Family Feast s1 - Ep 13 - The Balinese
program.description_short: Sean and his family join a local Balinese community for their annual celebration of Galungan, a festival featuring delicious food, offerings to Balinese Gods and traditional dance.
program.description_long: Think back for a moment to the first time you were invited to dinner at your best friend or prospective partner's home - sharing a meal with someone else's family is still one of the most intimate and insightful experiences that we have available to us in the modern age. During My Family Feast, we'll meet members of the entire family - grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles and second cousins - to gain a complete insight into their particular immigrant experience, be they first generation, second generation, or eighth generation Australians. As we learn a new recipe we will discover the stories and traditions that this particular recipe evokes.
program.description_series: My Family Feast is a celebration of food, family and stories of life. Food is the central theme that brings families and communities together and this new series defines a family as a group of people who come together to eat, to talk, to have fun and to support each other: a group of people who are very often in a strange land trying to retain their traditional culture and to live and understand a new culture.

program.description_short: Food Safari ventures into the beautifully healthy world of Korean food, full of colour and surprises. Martial arts champion & top Adelaide chef Chung Jae Lee of Mapo restaurant reveals the basic ingredients needed for his cuisine.
program.description_long: Maeve O'Meara leads a voyage of culinary discovery through the restaurants and home kitchens of Australia in a new series of Food Safari. Maeve introduces both world class chefs and inspiring home cooks - most of whom were born overseas, but now call Australia home. Each episode is a detailed journey into a single cuisine, with tips on how to source ingredients locally, as well as prepare and cook them with authentic results.

program.title: Insight
program.description_short: Ouch! Why can some people endure intense pain, while others can't? Guests who feel no pain, phantom limb pain and chronic pain join our athletes and share their secrets for getting on top of niggling injuries, discussing the relationship between body and mind.
program.description_series: Each week on Insight, award-winning journalist Jenny Brockie hosts a lively conversation and dives deep into a single topic. Insight brings together surprising and unpredictable guests: people with first-hand experience of the issue as well as experts and those with strong opinions.
